title: 5 Simple Steps to Delete Rows on Google Sheets on Android

steps.title: Open Google Sheets on your Android.
steps.content: Open Google Sheets on your Android. The Google Sheets app looks like a six-column, white table on a green sheet icon on your Apps menu.

steps.title: Tap the file you want to edit.
steps.content: Tap the file you want to edit. Find the file you want to edit on the list of your saved spreadsheets, and open it.

steps.title: Tap and hold a row number next to a row.
steps.content: Tap and hold a row number next to a row. Find the row you want to delete, and long-press the row number next to it on the left-hand side of the sheet. This will highlight the entire row. Your options will pop up on a toolbar.

steps.title: Tap the ⋮ icon on the pop-up toolbar.
steps.content: Tap the ⋮ icon on the pop-up toolbar. It's on the right-hand side of the toolbar. Tapping will open a list of all your options.

steps.title: Tap the DELETE button on the menu.
steps.content: Tap the DELETE button on the menu. This will delete the entire selected row. All the rows below the deleted row will be shifted upwards on your spreadsheet.
